units.title: Culture organoids
units.text: 1 Culture organoids (or organoid co-cultures) in 50 µl of Matrigel and 200 µl of medium in a standard 96-well tissue culture plate.
units.rationale: Establishes the starting organoid cultures for downstream analysis.

units.title: S‑phase cell labeling
units.text: 2 Add 127IdU directly to culture medium to a ﬁnal concentration of 25 µM (10 µl of 0.5 mM stock added to 200 µl of medium). Gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s to mix the medium and incubate the plate for 25 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Incorporates a thymidine analog to identify cells in S phase.

units.title: Phosphatase and protease inhibitor treatment
units.text: 3 Add the protease inhibitor cocktail (100× stock; see Reagents) and PhosSTOP (40× stock; see Reagents) directly to culture medium, gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s and incubate for 5 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Preserves protein phosphorylation and antigen integrity before fixation.

units.title: Fixation
units.text: 4 Remove culture medium by pipetting. Add 200 µl of prewarmed (37 °C) 4% (vol/vol) PFA into each well, taking care not to disrupt Matrigel. Incubate for 60 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Cross‑links proteins to lock cellular states in place.

units.title: Post‑fixation wash
units.text: 5 Remove PFA solution by pipetting, taking care not to disturb the Matrigel. Wash the cells with PBS on a rocker (speed set at ~45 rpm throughout the protocol) for 10 min at room temperature (~20 °C). Repeat the wash.
units.rationale: Removes residual fixative and prepares cells for live/dead staining.

units.title: Live/dead discrimination
units.text: 6 Remove PBS by pipetting. Add 200 µl of 0.25 µM 194cisplatin/PBS solution to each well and incubate for 10–15 min on a rocker at room temperature.
units.rationale: Labels dead cells with cisplatin for downstream exclusion.

units.title: Cisplatin wash
units.text: 7 Remove the 194cisplatin solution by pipetting. Wash cells with PBS on a rocker for 10 min at room temperature. Repeat the wash.
units.rationale: Eliminates excess cisplatin to prevent overstaining.

units.title: TOBis barcoding
units.text: 8 Transfer 200 µl of pre-aliquoted TOBis barcodes to corresponding organoid samples in a 96-well plate (from Step 7). Any barcode combination can be used to stain any culture condition (Supplementary Tables 3 and 4). Incubate the cells overnight at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Imparts a unique metal‑based barcode to each sample for multiplexed analysis.

units.title: Barcode quenching and wash
units.text: 9 Remove the barcoding solutions by pipetting and wash the cells with 200 µl of 2 mM glutathione/ CSB for 10 min on a rocker at room temperature. Repeat the wash twice.
units.rationale: Quenches unreacted barcodes and cleans the sample before dissociation.

units.title: Single‑cell dissociation
units.text:
11 Make up a dissociation solution of fresh 0.5 mg/ml dispase II, 0.2 mg/ml collagenase IV and 0.2 mg/ml DNase I in PBS at room temperature.
12 Remove PBS from the wells by pipetting and add the dissociation solution.
13 Scrape Matrigel droplets and pool all cells from all conditions with dissociation solution to a gentleMACS C‑Tube. Top up the dissociation solution to 5 ml/C‑Tube.
14 Dissociate organoids into single cells by using a gentleMACS Octo dissociator and the ‘Standard protocol’ (see Equipment setup) (Timing: ~50 min).
units.rationale: Breaks organoids into a single‑cell suspension suitable for mass cytometry.
